cxro.common.device.axis

Class AbstractAxis

  • java.lang.Object
    • cxro.common.device.axis.AbstractAxis
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Axis
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HydraAxis, IaiAxis

    public abstract class AbstractAxis
extends java.lang.Object
implements Axis
    Abstract base class for all motion control axes.

      • hasAuxEncoder

        public final boolean hasAuxEncoder()
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Determine if axis has auxiliary encoder.

        Certain axes have multiple or auxiliary encoders. This is particularly true for some stepper-driven systems where the primary position is determined by the step/microstep count, but a secondary encoder is available for more precise position information.

        Specified by:
        hasAuxEncoder in interface Axis
        Returns:
        true if encoder is present.

      • abortMove

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> abortMove()
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Stop motion, maximum deceleration.

        This operation can take some time. Therefore it is handled by a separate thread in the driver and the status is returned as a Future, just as for normal moves.

        Specified by:
        abortMove in interface Axis
        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • disable

        public abstract void disable()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Disables axis. This will turn axis motor off.

        NOTE: This will not assure that the motor is first stopped, nor that a brake will be applied. This must be performed separately by the application program before calling this method.

        Specified by:
        disable in interface Axis
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getLowerLimitSoft

        public final double getLowerLimitSoft()
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Return lower software limit (in SCALED units).

        NOTE: This is a software limit. The hardware limit is maintained by the driver and is available via the getLowerLimitHard method.

        Specified by:
        getLowerLimitSoft in interface Axis
        Returns:
        Axis lower software limit (scaled units)

      • getLowerLimitHard

        public final double getLowerLimitHard()
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Return lower hardware limit (in SCALED units).

        This is maintained by the device driver and is not directly modifiable via this interface.

        Specified by:
        getLowerLimitHard in interface Axis
        Returns:
        Lower hardware limit, in SCALED units

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Returns the given device name of the axis.

        The name is a readonly parameter that is used to signify the path to configuration data that is maintained by the driver. It represents a hierarchical path to the axis data via the associated component and device elements.

        For instance, the X axis of the zoneplate stage that is associated with the SHARP endstation, would be given the following name:

        • cxro/sharp/zp_stage/x

        Specified by:
        getName in interface Axis
        Returns:
        Full device name

      • getOffset

        public final double getOffset()
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Returns axis offset (in UNSCALED controller units).

        OFFSET = POS_UNSCALED - (SCALE * POS_SCALED).
        POS_SCALED = 0 when POS_UNSCALED = OFFSET.

        Specified by:
        getOffset in interface Axis
        Returns:
        OFFSET in unscaled units.

      • getSwitches

        public abstract boolean[] getSwitches()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        This method returns an array of booleans that represent the current status of the hardware switches on the controller.

        They are in the form: {Reverse_Switch, Forward_Switch, Home_Switch}.
        When true, the switch is active.

        Ex:
           switches[] = xAxis.getRawSwitches();
           if(switches[1]) // test Forward_Switch
             //throw error or act accordingly.

        Specified by:
        getSwitches in interface Axis
        Returns:
        switch array.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • initialize

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> initialize()
                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Initialize axis.

        This initiates an initialization operation. In most cases, this is a homing operation which finds either the home limit or encoder index and sets the UNSCALED position to zero.

        This operation typically takes a long time. Hence the method returns a Future object which can be tested for completion (@see java.util.concurrent.Future).

        The possible return values include:

        • AXIS_OK
        • AXIS_BUSY
        • DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT
        • DEST_BELOW_ULIMIT
        • STOPPED
        • LOCKED
        • DISABLED
        • UNINITIALIZED
        A return value of UNINITIALIZED indicates that the operation failed for unknown reasons.

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Axis
        Returns:
        Future result of operation (Integer).

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isEnabled

        public abstract boolean isEnabled()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Test if the axis has been enabled or disabled by the user.

        When an axis is disabled, it cannot receive any move commands.

        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Axis
        Returns:
        true if Enabled

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isInitialized

        public abstract boolean isInitialized()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        A test if the axis has been homed or initialized in some fashion.

        Most motion commands are prohibited until the axis is initialized.

        Specified by:
        isInitialized in interface Axis
        Returns:
        true if initialized

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Axis.initialize()

      • isStopped

        public abstract boolean isStopped()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Check for axis STOPPED.

        STOPPED = NOT MOVING.

        Does not check for DRIVE_OK. Client programs should usually call isReady() instead.

        Specified by:
        isStopped in interface Axis
        Returns:
        true if NOT_MOVING

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • moveAbsolute

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> moveAbsolute(double dest)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Absolute move in the SCALED coordinate system.

        The corresponding move in the UNSCALED (controller) units:

        POS_UNSCALED = (SCALE * POS_SCALED) + OFFSET

        Specified by:
        moveAbsolute in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        dest - move destination, SCALED

        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • moveAbsoluteRaw

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> moveAbsoluteRaw(double dest)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Absolute move in the UNSCALED coordinate system.

        This is intended to be used only for special purposes (such as fiducial finding). Normal axis operations should use the corresponding SCALED operation moveAbsolute.

        NOTE: This is a convenience method. It is equivalent to:

        moveAbsolute((destRaw - getOffset()) / getScale());

        Specified by:
        moveAbsoluteRaw in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        dest - move destination, UNSCALED

        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • moveRelative

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> moveRelative(double dist)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Relative move in SCALED coordinate system.

        The corresponding move in the UNSCALED (controller) units:

        DIST_UNSCALED = (SCALE * DIST_SCALED)

        Specified by:
        moveRelative in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        dist - move distance, SCALED

        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • moveRelativeRaw

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> moveRelativeRaw(double dist)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Relative move in UNSCALED coordinate system.

        This is intended to be used only for special purposes (such as fiducial finding). Normal axis operations should use the corresponding SCALED operation moveRelative.

        NOTE: This is a convenience method. It is equivalent to:

        moveRelative(distRaw / getScale());

        Specified by:
        moveRelativeRaw in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        dist - move distance, UNSCALED

        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Specified by:
        setAxisUnits in interface Axis

      • setLowerLimitSoft

        public final int setLowerLimitSoft(double lowerLimit)
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Sets the lower software limit (in SCALED units).

        This returns the same values as for a move operation, but the DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT and DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT values have a special meaning here:

        • DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT : Software limit would exceed hardware upper limit
        • DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT : Software limit would exceed hardware lower limit
        The limit cannot be changed if the Axis is otherwise BUSY or LOCKED by another thread.

        Specified by:
        setLowerLimitSoft in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        lowerLimit - - software lower limit, in SCALED units

        Returns:
        status:
          AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
          AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
          DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
          DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
          STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
          LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
          DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
          UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

      • setOffset

        public final void setOffset(double offset)
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Sets the axis offset (in UNSCALED units).

        POS_SCALED = (POS_UNSCALED - OFFSET)/SCALE

        Note that this will have an effect on the software limits. The unscaled value for the soft limits will remain fixed, but the scaled value for the software limits will now be:

        LIMIT_SCALED = (LIMIT_UNSCALED - OFFSET)/SCALE

        Specified by:
        setOffset in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        offset - in UNSCALED units.

      • setPosition

        public final void setPosition(double pos)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Define current SCALED position.

        Sets the current position to any defined position in the SCALED coordinate system. NOTE: this does not modify the UNSCALED controller position; rather, it modifies the OFFSET so that:

        POS_SCALED = (POS_UNSCALED - OFFSET)/SCALE

        Specified by:
        setPosition in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        pos - New value for current position.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setScale

        public final void setScale(double scale)
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Sets the SCALE factor.

        Defines the relationship between SCALED and UNSCALED displacements:

        DIST_UNSCALED = (SCALE * DIST_SCALED)

        For example, if the Encoder has 250000 counts/cm and the user wants axis units to be in mm, then the scale is set to 25000.

        If the axis is inverted, set the scale to negative.

        Specified by:
        setScale in interface Axis

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double speed)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Set axis speed (in SCALED units/s).

        Specified by:
        setSpeed in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        speed - in SCALED units/s.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setTarget

        public int setTarget(double dest)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Set axis target destination (absolute, in SCALED units)

        Specified by:
        setTarget in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        dest - target for move destination, SCALED

        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setTargetRaw

        public int setTargetRaw(double rawDest)
                 throws java.io.IOException

        Specified by:
        setTargetRaw in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        rawDest - target for move destination, UNSCALED

        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : rawDest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : rawDest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setUpperLimitSoft

        public final int setUpperLimitSoft(double upperLimit)
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Sets the upper software limit (in SCALED units).

        This returns the same values as for a move operation, but the DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT and DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT values have a special meaning here:

        • DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT : Software limit would exceed hardware upper limit
        • DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT : Software limit would exceed hardware lower limit
        The limit cannot be changed if the Axis is otherwise BUSY or LOCKED by another thread.

        Specified by:
        setUpperLimitSoft in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        upperLimit - - software upper limit, in SCALED units

        Returns:
        status:
          AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
          AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
          DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
          DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
          STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
          LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
          DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
          UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

      • stopMove

        public final java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> stopMove()
                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Stop motion, normal deceleration.

        This operation can take some time. Therefore it is handled by a separate thread in the driver and the status is returned as a Future, just as for normal moves.

        Specified by:
        stopMove in interface Axis
        Returns:
        status - result at end of move
        AXIS_OK = 0 : Move started.
        AXIS_BUSY = 2 : Axis not ready.
        DEST_BELOW_LLIMIT = 3 : Dest below lower limit, move not initiated.
        DEST_ABOVE_ULIMIT = 4 : Dest above upper limit, move not initiated.
        STOPPED = 5 : Axis has been "halted".
        LOCKED = 6 : Axis has been locked by another thread.
        DISABLED = 7 : Axis disabled, usually means drive power off.
        UNINITIALIZED = 8 : Axis is not initialized.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Sets the auxiliary encoder SCALE factor.

        Defines the relationship between SCALED and UNSCALED displacements:

        DIST_UNSCALED = (SCALE * DIST_SCALED)

        For example, if the Encoder has 250000 counts/cm and the user wants axis units to be in mm, then the scale is set to 25000.

        Specified by:
        setAuxEncoderScale in interface Axis

      • getAuxEncoderOffset

        public double getAuxEncoderOffset()
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Returns the auxiliary encoder offset (in UNSCALED controller units).

        OFFSET = POS_UNSCALED - (SCALE * POS_SCALED).
        POS_SCALED = 0 when POS_UNSCALED = OFFSET.

        If hasAuxEncoder = false, then return main encoder offset.

        Specified by:
        getAuxEncoderOffset in interface Axis
        Returns:
        OFFSET in unscaled units.

      • setAuxEncoderOffset

        public void setAuxEncoderOffset(double auxEncoderOffset)
        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Sets the auxiliary encoder offset (in UNSCALED units).

        POS_SCALED = (POS_UNSCALED - OFFSET)/SCALE

        If hasAuxEncoder = false, then action is same as setOffset().

        Specified by:
        setAuxEncoderOffset in interface Axis
        Parameters:
        auxEncoderOffset - in UNSCALED units.

        Description copied from interface: Axis
        Define current auxiliary encoder SCALED position.

        Sets the current auxiliary encoder position to any defined position in the SCALED coordinate system.
        NOTE: this does not modify the UNSCALED controller position; rather, it modifies only the OFFSET so that:

        POS_SCALED = (POS_UNSCALED - OFFSET)/SCALE

        If hasAuxEncoder = false, then has same behaviour as setPosition.

        Specified by:

      • lock

        public final void lock()
        Locks the axis from getting any other motion commands until the axis is then unlocked.
        This is used in the case where the user wants to complete uninterrupted complex motions without another process/command from interrupting.

        An example of this would be a homing procedure.

      • unlock

        public final void unlock()
        Unlocks the axis from a previous lock.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface Axis
        See Also:
        Axis.isLocked()

      • trylock

        public final boolean trylock()
        Tries to see if the axis is locked. If it's already locked, it will return false. If unlocked, the axis will become locked and will return true.

        Returns:

      • isLocked

        public final boolean isLocked()
        Test for a previously stated lock.

        Specified by:
        isLocked in interface Axis
        Returns:
        true for the axis being locked.
